intro: Adenophora morrisonensis subsp. uehatae, commonly known as the Uehata's bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, pale blue to white flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly smaller flowers and narrower leaves compared to the typical form. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture, though it is relatively rare in the wild.
